name: Adamantine
description: While wearing a set of armor made from adamantium, any critical hits you suffer are reduced to regular hits.

name: Ammunition
description: You may use a weapon with this type to make a ranged attack, at the cost of 1 ammunition per attack. This ammunition could be arrows, bolts, darts, or a similar projectile. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver or other case is considered part of the attack action.

name: Finesse
description: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you may choose whether to use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack rolls.

name: Heavy
description: Creatures of Small size have disadvantage when using heavy weapons.

name: Light
description: When wielding a light weapon in your main hand, you may also wield another light weapon in your offhand.

name: Loading
description: When attacking with a weapon that has the loading feature, you must use an action to reload your weapon before you can attack with it again.

name: Mithral
description: Armor made of mithral does not impose disadvantage on stealth rolls.

name: Reach
description: A weapon with the Reach tag has an extra 5 feet of range for all melee attacks (10 feet instead of the usual 5 feet range for melee weapons).

name: Silvered
description: Some monsters have immunity or resistance to attacks made with non-magical weapons. You may hire a blacksmith to silver your weapon, potentially circumnavigating this resistance. The cost to silver a weapon is typically around 100 gold, paying for both the silver and the expertise to plate the weapon without damaging its effectiveness.

name: Special - Blunderbuss
description: This ranged weapon does not have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that are within 5 feet of you.

name: Special - Lance
description: You have disadvantage when you use the lance against a target within 5 feet of you. When you arenâ€™t mounted, the lance requires two hands to wield.

name: Special - Net
description: Any large or smaller creature hit by the net is restrained until they are freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are huge or larger. A creature can use its action to free itself or another creature from the net, with a DC 10 Strength check for success. Dealing 5 damage to the net (Defense 10) also destroys it and frees the creature trapped inside.

name: Thrown
description: You may make a ranged attack with a thrown weapon. When making a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, you use whatever ability you would normally use for the weapon if it was a melee attack. For example, a javelin does not have the finesse tag, so a ranged attack with it must use your strength modifier. A dagger has the finesse tag, so for a ranged attack you may use either your strength or your dexterity for any attacks made with it at range.

name: Two-Handed
description: This weapon must be wielded with two hands in order to make an attack with it. It can be held with a single hand while not using it (albeit in an unwieldy fashion)

name: Versatile
description: This weapon can be used in either on or two hands. The dice in parentheses is the dice you use for damage rolls when wielding the weapon with both hands.
